qas.question: What term do those who disagree with Hayek use to describe his ideals?
Who was it that claimed Hayek's The Constitution of Liberty to be an thorough example of neoliberal philosophy?
Whose ideals does Brittan believe to win out over Hayek's?

context: His opponents have attacked Hayek as a leading promoter of "<a0_0>neoliberalism<a0_0/>". A British scholar, <a1_0>Samuel Brittan<a1_0/>, concluded in 2010, "Hayek's book [The Constitution of Liberty] is still probably the most comprehensive statement of the underlying ideas of the moderate free market philosophy espoused by neoliberals." Brittan adds that although <a2_0>Raymond Plant<a2_0/> (2009) comes out in the end against Hayek's doctrines, Plant gives The Constitution of Liberty a "more thorough and fair-minded analysis than it has received even from its professed adherents".
